poem:
"Imprisoned in Pupils"

Ilaria in chains,
Italian antifascist queen,
Insects, vermin crowd.
Degrade not this fervent heart-
inside prison, freedom starts.
A year of confinement,
Bitter but not impotent,
Images as testament.
One woman, a world apart,
Feet and hands bound, yet spirit, 
Inexhaustibly resistant.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Italian antifascist says cell in Hungary crawling with mice and bugs An Italian antifascist activist who was brought in chains to a court in Hungary for allegedly attacking neo-Nazis has written a letter denouncing the degrading conditions in which she has been held in prison for nearly a year as outrage grows over her case at home. Images of Ilaria Salis, 39, with her hands cuffed and chained and her feet locked together as she". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
